bill_title: to clarify provisions relating to teacher contracts and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the amount of state aid to special education to local school districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-37 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a school district's entitlement for state aid to special education may not exceed the school district's special education expenditures for the previous school fiscal year. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify provisions relating to teacher contracts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-43-6.3 be amended to read as follows: 13-43-6.3. Until a teacher is in or beyond the fourth consecutive term of employment as a teacher with the school district, a school board may or may not renew the teacher's contract. The superintendent or school board shall give written notice of nonrenewal by April fifteenth but is not required to give further process or a reason for nonrenewal. After a teacher is in or beyond the fourth consecutive term of employment as a teacher with the school district, § § 13-43-6.1 and 13-43-6.2 apply to any nonrenewal of the teacher's contract. Written notice of nonrenewal of a teacher's contract shall be given by April fifteenth. Acceptance by the teacher of an offer from the district to enter into a new contract with the teacher shall be in the manner specified in the offer. Failure of the teacher to accept the offer in the manner specified shall result in the termination of the existing contract between the teacher and the district at the end of its term. After a teacher is in or beyond the fourth consecutive term of employment as a teacher with the school district, § § 13-43-6.1 and 13-43-6.2 apply to any nonrenewal of the teacher's contract. Written notice of nonrenewal of a teacher's contract shall be given by April fifteenth. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
